a39340114475.title: There is no way the Lakers would trade Ingram and their pick for Paul George.

paragraphs.text: There is no way the Lakers would trade Ingram and their pick for Paul George. If the Lakers get to keep their pick this year they can simply wait a year and sign George in free agency. If Indiana doesn’t upgrade their roster around George he is leaving and they have no way to do that. He wants to play in LA and gutting the team isn’t going to make…
paragraphs.name: 34a6

8070bdcb96df.title: It comes down to this: The Celtics didn’t want to trade 80% of their movable assets to accomplish…

paragraphs.text: It comes down to this: The Celtics didn’t want to trade 80% of their movable assets to accomplish 50% of what they need to do to really contend.
paragraphs.name: 3bc7

baaa836372ed.title: I would love to ask Danny Ainge what he thinks the actual talent gap is between Paul George, Jimmy…

paragraphs.text: I would love to ask Danny Ainge what he thinks the actual talent gap is between Paul George, Jimmy Butler & Gordon Hayward.

Silly example but Paul George has an NBA 2K2017 rating of 89, Jimmy Butler is an 88, Hayward is an 84. Hayward doesn’t have the reputation as being an elite defender, but he’s a better shooter than Butler and his stats this season are nearly identical to George’s.
paragraphs.name: ce96

paragraphs.text: Enough with the “dark” references PG13. Just go out and play and prove that you are worth what Larry was asking in return for you

366cb33604dd.title: I get the idea behind giving vets an option to free themselves from situations they’d rather not be…

paragraphs.text: I get the idea behind giving vets an option to free themselves from situations they’d rather not be in on teams who have no use for them, but man, the rich get richer.
paragraphs.name: c955

d0aff7d8819b.title: If Bogut will be able to return to the warriors, Cleveland should get him just to stop that from…

paragraphs.text: If Bogut will be able to return to the warriors, Cleveland should get him just to stop that from happening. If it comes down to a interpretation of the rules where Silver gets the final say, he could say ‘not this time warriors, enough loophole exploiting for you.’
paragraphs.name: ed9b

d7d8c79c67d4.title: I don’t understand why a team wouldn’t put in a waiver claim for Deron Williams.

paragraphs.text: I don’t understand why a team wouldn’t put in a waiver claim for Deron Williams. He’d be a useful veteran leader for a team like Philadelphia, or why not a return to Utah? They don’t have a single player over 4 assists per game and they’re below cap and were supposedly interested in a trade.

7973075212bc.name: Brandon Anderson

2aee057962b9.bio: You think I'll let it go, you're mad, you've got another thing comin'.
2aee057962b9.name: Mike Chandler

paragraphs.text: Paul George was wrapped up in trade rumors involving the Lakers, Celtics, and Nuggets, and he didn’t seem happy when talking to reporters Thursday afternoon. “I kind of was on the ropes just like you guys were on what was about to happen. It was kind of a dark moment of uncertainty,” George said. “That was the frustrating part. You want me to be your guy here, I thought I would’ve been in the loop a little more on that.” George has said publicly he’s committed to the Pacers, but like a politician, he has his private position, too. The Pacers star forward is “hell-bent on heading to Laker Land,” USA Today’s Sam Amick reported Thursday, which my sources indicate, as well; there’s little doubt that George will opt out of his contract at the end of the 2017–18 season.
paragraphs.name: d0ae
